intro: Saussurea ischnoides, commonly known as the Tibetan saffron or yellow gentian, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas and Central Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stem and striking yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, alpine environments and is adapted to cold, high-altitude conditions. Its medicinal properties have been traditionally used in Tibetan and Chinese herbal medicine. Saussurea ischnoides is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated for horticultural purposes.
